text: I usually make up my mind about a man in ten seconds, and I very rarely change it.
author: Margaret Thatcher

text: I only like two kinds of men, domestic and imported.
author: Mae West

text: Man as an individual is a genius. But men in the mass form the headless monster, a great, brutish idiot that goes where prodded.
author: Charlie Chaplin

text: Honor is simply the morality of superior men.
author: H. L. Mencken
